name: imageDrawBeveledRect
syntax: imageDrawBeveledRect(name, x, y, width, height, raised [, filled])
member: someImage.drawBeveledRect(x, y, width, height, raised [, filled])
description: Draws a rectangle with beveled edges.

params.name: name
params.description: The image on which this operation is performed.

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate of the rectangle.

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate of the rectangle.

params.name: raised
params.description: Specify whether the rectangle appears raised above the surface or sunk into the surface

params.name: filled
params.description: Specify whether the rectangle is filled.

examples.title: Tag Syntax
examples.description: This example shows how to create a bevel-edged rectangle.
examples.code:
<!--- Use the imageNew function to create a 200x200-pixel image. ---> 
 <cfset myImage=imageNew("",200,200)> 
 <!--- Turn on antialiasing to improve image quality. --->  
 <cfset imageSetAntialiasing(myImage,"on")> 
 <!--- Set the drawing color for the image to light gray. ---> 
 <cfset imageSetDrawingColor(myImage,"lightgray")> 
 <!--- Draw a 3D gray, filled, raised rectangle. --->  
 <cfset imageDrawBeveledRect(myImage,50,50,100,75,"yes","yes")> 
 <!--- Display the image in a browser. --->  
 <cfimage source="#myImage#" action="writeToBrowser">

examples.title: Using drawBeveledRect member function
examples.description: CF11+ Lucee4.5+ Create a new image and place a raised beveled rectangle at its center
